t: The*pn desert and the parched land will be glad; the*ld wilderness will rejoice and blossom. Like*ln the crocus,

it will burst into bloom; it*ld will rejoice greatly and shout for joy. The*ln glory of Lebanon will be given to it, the*ld splendor of Carmel and Sharon; they*ln will see the glory of the Lord,*s the*ld splendor of our God.
Strengthen*pn the feeble hands, steady*ld the knees that give way;
say*ln to those with fearful hearts, “Be*ld strong, do not fear; your*ln God will come, he*ld will come with vengeance; with*ln divine retribution he*ld will come to save you.”
Then*pn will the eyes of the blind be opened and*ld the ears of the deaf unstopped.
Then*ln will the lame leap like a deer, and*ld the mute tongue shout for joy. Water*ln will gush forth in the wilderness and*ld streams in the desert.
The*ln burning sand will become a pool, the*ld thirsty ground bubbling springs. In*ln the haunts where jackals once lay, grass*ld and reeds and papyrus will grow.
And*pn a highway will be there; it*ld will be called the Way of Holiness; it*ld will be for those who walk on that Way. The*ln unclean will not journey on it; wicked*ld fools will not go about on it.
No*ln lion will be there, nor*ld any ravenous beast; they*ld will not be found there. But*ln only the redeemed will walk there,

and*ld those the Lord*s has rescued will return. They*ln will enter Zion with singing; everlasting*ld joy will crown their heads. Gladness*ln and joy will overtake them, and*ld sorrow and sighing will flee away.
